intro: Cacalia maximowicziana var. alata, commonly known as the winged bellflower, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Campanulaceae and is characterized by its striking, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pale blue. The plant features slender, branching stems and hairy leaves that are often tinged with silver. Its most distinctive trait is the presence of winged structures on the calyx, giving it its common name. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in rocky or alpine habitats.
